articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.title: US STOCKS-Wall St ends up despite Middle East tensions as tech-related shares gain
articles.description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Monday, rebounding from Friday's losses as investors brushed aside worries about increased tensions in the Middle East and shares of Alphabet and other internet names gained.
articles.content:
(Updates to close) 
* Energy index rises as crude climbs 
* Alphabet jumps on bullish brokerage recommendation 
* Indexes: Dow up 0.2%, S&P 500 up 0.4%, Nasdaq gains 0.6% (For a live blog on the U.S. stock market, click or type LIVE/ in a news window) … [+2454 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Soccer-Lukaku double gives Inter impressive win at Napoli
articles.description: Inter Milan forward Romelu Lukaku scored twice, the first from a run which started inside his own half, to lead his side to a 3-1 win at Napoli which kept them top of Serie A on Monday.
articles.content:
NAPLES, Italy (Reuters) - Inter Milan forward Romelu Lukaku scored twice, the first from a run which started inside his own half, to lead his side to a 3-1 win at Napoli which kept them top of Serie A on Monday. 
Lautaro Martinez was also on target for Inter… [+923 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Arsenal edge past Leeds in FA Cup third round
articles.description: Arsenal's Reiss Nelson scored early in the second half to secure a 1-0 win over battling Championship leaders Leeds United in the FA Cup third round at The Emirates on Monday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Arsenal’s Reiss Nelson scored early in the second half to secure a 1-0 win over battling Championship leaders Leeds United in the FA Cup third round at The Emirates on Monday. 
Nelson put a near full-strength home side ahead in the 55th mi… [+956 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Leaked U.S. letter to Iraq was a poorly worded draft - top U.S. general
articles.description: A leaked letter from the U.S. military to Iraq that created impressions of an imminent U.S. withdrawal on Monday was a poorly worded draft document meant only to underscore increased movement of forces, the top U.S. military officer told reporters.
articles.content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A leaked letter from the U.S. military to Iraq that created impressions of an imminent U.S. withdrawal on Monday was a poorly worded draft document meant only to underscore increased movement of forces, the top U.S. military officer tol… [+1785 chars]

articles.title: VP Pence praises Venezuela's Guaido on election win
articles.description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence congratulated Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido for his re-election as head of Congress, describing Guaido as the "only legitimate president" of Venezuela, a person familiar with the matter said.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Vice President Mike Pence congratulated Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido for his re-election as head of Congress, describing Guaido as the “only legitimate president” of Venezuela, a person familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: Maduro-backed Venezuelan legislator calls elections council main priority
articles.description: A Venezuelan lawmaker sworn in by the ruling socialist party as the new head of parliament said on Monday that naming a new electoral council to preside over free and fair elections was the body's main priority.
articles.content:

articles.title: Brazil working on policy to smooth impact of oil price spikes -minister
articles.description: Brazil's government is working on a policy to reduce the local impact of spikes in international oil prices, Mines and Energy Minister Bento Albuquerque told reporters on Monday.
articles.content:
BRASILIA (Reuters) - Brazil’s government is working on a policy to reduce the local impact of spikes in international oil prices, Mines and Energy Minister Bento Albuquerque told reporters on Monday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Weinstein indicted in L.A. on day New York rape trial starts
articles.description: Once powerful Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein was indicted in Los Angeles on Monday on sex crime charges just hours after he appeared in a New York court for the start of his rape trial. Jillian Kitchener has more.
articles.content:
Posted 
Once powerful Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein was indicted in Los Angeles on Monday on sex crime charges just hours after he appeared in a New York court for the start of his rape trial. Jillian Kitchener has more.

articles.author: Herbert Lash
articles.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Gold surges on Mideast risk but stocks pare losses
articles.description: Gold prices shot to an almost seven-year high on Monday as U.S.-Iranian tensions drove demand for safe-haven assets and pushed a gauge of global equity markets lower, but shares on Wall Street rebounded on a less worrisome view of events.
articles.content:
* Gold hits almost 7-year high on safe-haven demand 
* MSCI world index pares losses, U.S. stocks rebound 
* Investors turn less risk-adverse as caution reigns 
* Dollar eases against Swiss franc

articles.description: University entrance exams to be taken by 300,000 students around Chile were disrupted in some cities on Monday by fresh protests over inequality and elitism, with some students blocking access to test sites and burning exam papers.
